channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report E-2023090689
item.description:
Report E-2023090689

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: BALTIMORE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 12, 2023, one (1) box of UN2031 was punctured and released approximately less-than one (<1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to remediate the site. MEG deconstructed the pallet and removed one (1) damaged box from the pallet. The crew deployed a neutralizing agent to the trailer. The damaged product and spent neutralizer were placed into two (2) 55-gallon drums and the packaging debris was placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Discovered damaged in unload.outer container had closures open and was wet.upon inspection bottes was shattered leaking out full contents. DescribePack: failure was due to package being dropped. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: loose absorb and chemical neutralizer were used to address spill.package was placed in hazmat tote and put under ventilation system.

item.title: Report X-2023081900
item.description:
Report X-2023081900

  • City: SPARROWS POINT
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: this is a unprocessed hazmat. hazmat labeling was present on outer container but was not shipped as a hazmat.outer container was wet.upon inspection 1 bottle had a loose cap leaking out approx 40 oz of content. DescribePack: failure was due to loose cap causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: fold absorb was used to address spill.package was placed in hazmat tote and put under ventilation system.

item.title: Report I-2023090095
item.description:
Report I-2023090095

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: Baltimore
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS MINIBULK, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PVS Minibulk Driver was unloading hydrochloric acid into a tank when the driver noticed the product was leaking out of a 55-gallon drum that was being used as an overflow tank. A valve on the customers tank was left open and the product was flowing into the overflow drum which had a crack in the bottom of it. The driver then shut off his valves from the truck to stop the unloading process to allow customer to close the valve. The product was flowing out of the cracked drum onto a concrete pad for 5 minutes. The customer took responsibility for the release and replaced the cracked drum to ensure there would not be a release in the future if the overflow tank would be utilized. The product was used in the cleaning process of the concrete pad where it was spilled.
